intro: Panterpa varians, commonly known as the variable panterpa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs.
